body_html:
@ed-alertedh I believe it was a hack where initially bool didn't work on GPU and int32 was somehow reserved for control flow reasons, but I don't hold that belief with high confidence.

Edit: That hack was back when tensorflow didn't have a mechanism for assigning ops to particular devices. It was int32 that didn't exist on GPU, so control flow could use int32 ops to ensure they'd stay on the CPU.

body:
@ed-alertedh I believe it was a hack where initially `bool` didn't work on GPU and `int32` was somehow reserved for control flow reasons, but I don't hold that belief with high confidence.

**Edit:** That hack was back when tensorflow didn't have a mechanism for assigning ops to particular devices.  It was `int32` that didn't exist on GPU, so control flow could use `int32` ops to ensure they'd stay on the CPU.
